data.title: Official Athletics Website
data.meta_description: Parker Mushinski (42) LHP - RELATED LINKS Photo Gallery (2017) Photo Gallery (2016) Photo Gallery (2015) MLB DRAFT Selected 211th overall in the seventh roun...
data.text:
MLB DRAFT

Selected 211th overall in the seventh round of the 2017 Major League Baseball Draft by the Houston Astros ... Tech's highest draft pick in the 2017 class.

JUNIOR SEASON (2017)

Pitched in 31 games over his junior campaign at Texas Tech ... All-Big 12 Honorable Mention ... Academic All-Big 12 First Team honoree ... helped Texas Tech to its second-straight Big 12 title and No. 5 NCAA National Seed ... made the most appearances among any student-athlete on the Red Raider pitching staff ... tallied a team-high six saves and put together a 3-2 record with a 2.15 ERA ... recorded 47 strikeouts over 37.2 innings of work ... allowed just 24 hits, five for extra bases, with 10 runs, nine earned, and 25 walks ... opposing hitters put together a measly .185 clip against him at the plate ... did not allow a hit in 16 of his 31 appearances ... kept runners off the board in 24 outings ... RANKINGS ... topped out at fourth in the conference in appearances on the mound, good for 36th nationally ... his six saves ranked seventh in the conference & 129th in the country ... BIG 12 GAMES ... had 12 outings during conference play, picking up two saves with a 1-0 record ... pieced together a 2.45 ERA over 14.2 innings of work out of the pen ... racked up 19 strikeouts and seven walks, giving up just four runs on nine hits ... only one hit went for extra bases, as opponents hit just .184 against him ... NON-CONFERENCE GAMES ... pitched in 19 games against non-conference foes ... finished with four saves and a 2-2 record ... had a 1.96 ERA over 23.0 frames pitched ... tallied 28 strikeouts and 18 walks, while giving up six runs, five earned, on 15 hits ... opposing batters put together a clip of .185 against him ... HOME GAMES ... pitched in 14 games in front of the Lubbock faithful ... tossed a 2.25 ERA with a 1-1 record and two saves at Dan Law Field at Rip Griffin Park ... recorded 21 strikeouts of 16.0 innings ... gave up just four runs on 12 hits ... AWAY GAMES ... made 12 appearances on the road, picking up three saves to go with a 2-0 record on the mound ... finished with a 1.88 ERA over 14.1 frames ... struck out 17 and walked seven, while giving up just three runs on seven hits ... allowed opposing batters to hit just .159 against him ... NIGHT GAMES ... pitched in eight games under the lights, putting together a 1.08 ERA with two saves ... rung up 12 batters over 8.1 frames, walking just five ... allowed only one run on three hits, as opponents hit .111 against him at the plate ... BIG 12 TOURNAMENT ... pitched in one game against Baylor on May 25, recording a save over 1.2 innings of work ... allowed just one hit and struck out two ... NCAA TOURNAMENT ... made two appearances in the NCAA Lubbock Regional ... recorded a save against Delaware on June 2 ... racked up four strikeouts over 2.2 innings of work ... SITUATIONAL ... left-handed hitters recorded a .178 average against him at the plate, while right-handed batters were just .188 hitting ... held opponents to a .157 clip with runners on base ... allowed just seven hits in 48 at-bats (.146) with two outs in an inning.

SOPHOMORE SEASON (2016)

Made 21 appearances out of the bullpen during his second season in the scarlet & black … member of the 2016 Big 12 Championship winning team … helped Texas Tech clinch its second College World Series berth in three years … tallied a 1.93 ERA over 14.0 innings pitched … averaged more strikeouts than innings pitched, with 15 K’s … also earned one save against TCU on May 1, shutting the down on a 3-1 victory … induced 10 fly outs and 12 ground outs … held opponents to a .163 batting average … a left-handed batter never recorded a hit against him in 22 at-bats … kept hitters to a .129 average with runners on base … averaged just 1.93 earned runs per game … notched a whopping 9.64 strikeouts per game … posted a season-high four strikeouts against New Mexico State on March 1 … did not allow a hit in 14 of his 21 outings … only allowed a run in two of his 21 appearances … IN BIG 12 PLAY … made six appearances during conference play ... only pitched 3.2 innings, striking out one batter and holding opponents to just a .214 batting average … NON-BIG 12 GAMES … posted a spotless 0.00 ERA in 15 appearances in non-conference games … pitched 10.1 innings, striking out 14 batters … gave up only four hits, keeping his opponent’s batting average down to .138 … HOME GAMES … made 10 appearances at Dan Law Field at Rip Griffin Park in 2016 … only allowed three runs, while striking out 10 batters … held his foes to a .111 batting average … ROAD/NEUTRAL SITE GAMES … posted one save in 11 appearances on the road … only pitched in 4.2 innings, but did not allow an earned run, while striking out five batters … AGAINST NATIONALLY RANKED OPPONENTS … put together another clean 0.00 ERA against ranked foes in seven appearances … recorded one save … pitched 2.1 innings, striking out two … MIDWEEK GAMES … just as successful in the middle of the week, never giving up a run in six appearances … struck out nine batters over 4.0 IP … didn’t allow a hit in a midweek contest … BIG 12 TOURNAMENT … made two appearances over 1.1 innings … allowed only one hit, while striking out one batter … NCAA LUBBOCK REGIONAL … made one appearance in the Lubbock Regional against New Mexico … pitched 1.1 inning against the Lobos, striking out two over that perfect stretch … COLLEGE WORLD SERIES … appeared for 0.2 innings against Coastal Carolina at the 2016 College World Series.

FRESHMAN SEASON (2015)

Made 17 appearances as a freshman (one start) ... finished 2-1 overall with a 6.38 primarily out of the bullpen ... combined for one shutout while totaling 24.0 innings with 21 strikeouts, 20 walks, 22 runs, 17 earned runs and 29 hits ... held opponents to a .305 average ... AGAINST NATIONALLY RANKED OPPONENTS ... appeared in three games, all in relief ... was 0-0 with a 2.70 ERA after allowing three runs (one earned) over 3.1 innings ... struck out four hitters while issuing five walks ... opponents hit just .154 overall ... IN BIG 12 PLAY ... called on three times out of the bullpen, finishing 0-1 with a 15.43 ERA ... totaled 2.1 innings in relief with four runs (all earned) and three hits ... struck out two hitters with six walks ... opponents hit .300 overall ... AT BIG 12 CHAMPIONSHIP ... made one appearance in relief against No. 2 TCU ... allowed an unearned run in his one inning of work ... HOME GAMES ... appeared in 11 games with one start ... compiled a 2-1 overall record with a 5.19 ERA ... allowed 13 runs (10 earned) and 22 hits over 17.1 innings ... recorded 15 strikeouts and 14 walks while opponents hit .324 overall ... ROAD/NEUTRAL SITE GAMES ... was 0-0 with a 11.12 ERA in his five appearances out of the bullpen ... surrendered nine runs (seven earned) and seven hits while striking out six and walking six ... opponents hit .292 overall ... SITUATIONAL ... opponents were just 7-for-24 (.292 average) with two outs in the inning ... MISCELLANEOUS ... tossed seven scoreless outings -- all in relief ... made four multiple-inning outings ... allowed one or fewer hits in 10 of his appearances ... SEASON HIGHLIGHTS ... made career debut during season-opening weekend against San Francisco (2/14) ... picked up first career win after tossing three innings in relief ... allowed just one run off three hits, a strikeout and four walks in the win ... marked his longest relief appearance of the season ... threw two shutout innings in his next appearance against Nevada (2/17) ... other victory came after a perfect inning of relief against New Mexico State (3/10) ... also tossed two shutout innings against Oral Roberts (March 18) ... made first career start against Grand Canyon (4/29) ... earned a no-decision after allowing four runs (three earned) over three complete innings.

HIGH SCHOOL

A four-year varsity letterwinner at Argyle High School for head coach Rickey Griffin... as a senior batted .382 with nine home runs, 38 RBI and .558 on-base percentage while posting a 2.10 ERA, 98 strikeouts and 51 innings pitched... District Most Valuable Player... All-Area... All-State... State Tournament All-Tournament Team... Perfect Game: No. 1 High School Left-Handed Pitcher in Texas... Perfect Game: No. 20 High School Left-Handed Pitcher in the Nation... as a junior went 5-1 with a 1.73 ERA and 63 strikeouts in only 28.1 innings... First Team 10-3A All-District as a junior... played for the Washington Nationals Area Code Team in 2013 managed by Jimmy Gonzalez and Tyler Wilt... helped lead team to a district title in 2013 while finishing 29-5 overall and advancing to the regional semifinals... played in numerous all-star games and showcases, including Texas Scouts Association All-Star Game at Minute Maid Park, Oakley Battle of the Borders All-America Game and Perfect Game Showcase Tournaments in Atlanta and Jupiter, Florida... CHOSE TEXAS TECH OVER: Oklahoma State, Texas, Arkansas, TCU, Oklahoma, Wichita State and Baylor.

PERSONAL

Parker Allen Mushinski... born in Arlington, Texas... son of Allen and Karen Mushinski... has two brothers, Austin and Connor... a sports management major at Texas Tech.
